generif.text: Gas1 is related to the GDNF alpha receptors and regulates Ret signaling
This review considers the possible involvement of GAS1 in genetic diseases, stem cell renewal, and cancer growth through its cooperative activity with Hedgehog (HH) growth factor and the HH receptor.
Gas1 is a molecule involved in cell arrest that can induce apoptosis when over-expressed in different cell lines.

Gas1 has all the expected properties of a melanoma tumor suppressor: suppression of metastasis in a spontaneous metastasis assay, promotion of apoptosis following dissemination of cells to secondary sites, and down-regulation in human melanoma metastasis.
Results present evidence demonstrating that Gas1 exerts its effects inhibiting cell growth and inducing apoptosis of glioma cells in the absence of Shh.
Results suggest that GAS1 might be a target to overcome multidrug resistance and provide a novel approach to identifying candidate genes that suppress chemoresistance of gastric cancers.
GAS1 is preferentially expressed by human bulge cells, compared to differentiated hair follicle keratinocytes
GAS1 could be considered a candidate locus for one of the types of human holoprosencephaly.
Meta-analysis of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Growth arrest-specific gene 1 contributes to predicting metastasis or recurrence in stage II and III colorectal cancer.
Gas1 is a novel APP-interacting protein involved in the control of APP maturation and processing.
we demonstrate that sequence variants in GAS1 can impair its physical interaction with SHH, suggesting a decrease in the SHH downstream signaling cascade as a pathogenic mechanism of disease.
Interference of endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi transport increased immature amyloid beta protein precursor accumulation upon Gas1 expression in lipid raft fractions.
GAS1 induced the activity of caspase-3 and resulting in apoptosis of the cells.
Growth arrest-specific gene 1 is downregulated and inhibits tumor growth in gastric cancer.
GAS1 is a novel endogenous inhibitor of glomerular mesangial cell proliferation.
This review summarizes the structure of Gas1 and molecular mechanism of action during embryonic development and cellular functions.
solutions structure and biophysical characterization of the multifaceted signalling effector protein growth arrest specific-1
the synergistic effect of Gas1 inhibition and GDNF against glutamate-induced cell injury in human SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells, is reported.
These results demonstrated that miR-184 and the GAS1/Akt pathway may be a potential therapeutic target for intervertebral disc degeneration.
Studies establish Gas1 as a negative regulator in colorectal cancer.
WT1 modulates Akt/JNK signaling pathway mediated autophagy by controlling the expression of growth arrest-specific 1 (Gas1).
Downregulation of GAS1 is associated with clear cell renal cell carcinoma.

t is relevant to investigate the potential additive effect of the overexpression of GAS1 and PTEN on tumor growth. In particular, we employed secreted forms of both GAS1 (tGAS1) and PTEN (PTEN-LONG, or PTEN-L) and tested their combined effect on glioma cells.
This study has identified Gas1 as a novel factor and mechanism through which microglia arrest the growth of human brain tumor-initiating cells for anti-tumor property.
Gas1 Regulates Patterning of the Murine and Human Dentitions through Sonic Hedgehog.

name: growth arrest specific 1

pid.name: Signaling events mediated by the Hedgehog family

summary: Growth arrest-specific 1 plays a role in growth suppression.  GAS1 blocks entry to S phase and prevents cycling of normal and transformed cells.  Gas1 is a putative tumor suppressor gene. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
